function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inadequate space planning and design in buildings can lead to inefficient utilization of space and hinder the ability to accommodate public health measures during pandemics.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission due to overcrowding and inadequate space for necessary public health measures.","Mitigation":"Re-evaluate building design standards to include flexibility for transformation and pandemic response, prioritize efficient space utilization, and consider retrofitting existing buildings for adaptability.","Technologies":"Building Information Modeling (BIM) for space optimization, advanced ventilation and lighting systems for adaptable spaces.","People":"Building designers, architects, urban planners, facility managers, public health officials, and building occupants.","Owner":"Building owners, developers, government agencies, and public health organizations."},{"Description":"High cost and technical complexity of transforming existing buildings for pandemic response can limit the feasibility of design interventions.","Impact":"Limited ability to transform and adapt buildings to address public health needs during pandemics, leading to potential transmission risks and insufficient facilities for disease control.","Mitigation":"Invest in adaptive building technologies, streamline regulatory processes for building adaptations, and provide financial incentives for building transformations.","Technologies":"Adaptive building materials, modular construction methods, energy-efficient retrofitting technologies.","People":"Building owners, developers, government agencies, financial institutions, construction firms, and public health organizations.","Owner":"Building owners, developers, government agencies, and financial institutions."},{"Description":"Inefficient space utilization in car parking configurations can impact the ability to repurpose parking spaces for public health needs during pandemics.","Impact":"Limited ability to use parking spaces for alternative purposes such as testing sites, vaccination centers, or temporary medical facilities, reducing the capacity for pandemic response.","Mitigation":"Explore innovative parking design strategies, prioritize adaptable parking configurations, and leverage technology for efficient space utilization.","Technologies":"Automated parking systems, smart parking sensors, and modular parking structures.","People":"Urban planners, facility managers, and public health officials.","Owner":"Local government, property developers, and facility managers."}]}
